title._content: [Portrait of Henry Allen, Onyx, New York, N.Y., ca. May 1946] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Henry Allen, Onyx, New York, N.Y., ca. May 1946] 1 negative : b&w ; 3 1/4 x 4 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Red is the hardest working man on The Street. With co-leader J. C. Higginbotham, Red gives his cellar a party atmosphere. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 003 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: The Record Changer, v. 5, no. 3 (May 46, 1946), p. 10. Subjects: Allen, Henry, 1908-1967 Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Trumpet players--1940-1950. Fifty-second Street (New York, N.Y.)--1940-1950. Onyx Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.00041 Call Number: LC-GLB13- 0004
